extendedIngredients.name: belgian endive
extendedIngredients.original: 5 medium heads Belgian endive, ends trimmed and cut into 1-inch circles
extendedIngredients.originalName: Belgian endive, ends trimmed and cut into 1-inch circles

extendedIngredients.name: corn kernels
extendedIngredients.original: 2/3 cup defrosted corn kernels or 1/2 ear corn, cooked and kernels removed
extendedIngredients.originalName: defrosted corn kernels or 1/2 ear corn, cooked and kernels removed

extendedIngredients.name: green apple
extendedIngredients.original: 1 medium green apple, peeled, cored, and cut into 1-inch cubes
extendedIngredients.originalName: green apple, peeled, cored, and cut into 1-inch cubes

extendedIngredients.name: gruyere cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 pound Gruyere cheese, rind removed and diced into 1-inch cubes
extendedIngredients.originalName: Gruyere cheese, rind removed and diced into 1-inch cubes

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup and 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: pomegranate seeds
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tablespoons dried cranberries, or the seeds of 1 small pomegranate
extendedIngredients.originalName: dried cranberries, or the seeds of 1 small pomegranate

title: Holiday Salad
summary: Need a gluten free side dish? Holiday Salad could be an outstanding recipe to try. This recipe serves 4 and costs $2.41 per serving. One serving contains 343 calories, 11g of protein, and 27g of fat. 47 people have made this recipe and would make it again. It is brought to you by Foodnetwork. A mixture of the seeds of 1 pomegranate, gruyere cheese, pepper, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 15 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 66%, this dish is good. Fun Reindeer Antlers Holiday Treats | Holiday Cookie Swap Idea, Holiday Salad, and Holiday Salad are very similar to this recipe.
instructions: Watch how to make this recipe.                    In a small bowl whisk together the lemon juice, salt, pepper and olive oil. Set aside.                          Put the endive and apples into a large decorative serving bowl. Squeeze the juice of half a lemon into the bowl and toss to coat the endive and apples so they don't turn brown. Add the cheese and avocado, and then add the cranberries and corn.                          Pour the dressing over the salad just before serving and toss to coat.

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.
In a small bowl whisk together the lemon juice, salt, pepper and olive oil. Set aside.
Put the endive and apples into a large decorative serving bowl. Squeeze the juice of half a lemon into the bowl and toss to coat the endive and apples so they don't turn brown.
Add the cheese and avocado, and then add the cranberries and corn.
Pour the dressing over the salad just before serving and toss to coat.
